channel.title: Eh...Any smart people?
channel.description:
The only reason I am posting this under General is because it is truly bothering me :X
Refer to this link for further ideas? http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,46809.0.html
Does anyone know how to bypass an email verification? If not, is there any way to send it to an alternate email address? I got an email at jimmyos@runescape.com but cannot verify it. I am haunted by the (E-mail Address Not Verified), and my inability to change my display name on Windows Live Messenger (MSN).
[quote="marluxia, post:28, topic:32261"][quote author=S!ms link=topic=46809.msg573751#msg573751 date=1165355906] Okay, now i need a way to bypass the crappy M$ passport protection for verification.. any idea? :P [/quote]
on the [url=https://account.live.com/verifysi.aspx?rp=summarypage]https://account.live.com/verifysi.aspx?rp=summarypage[/url] we could use a Javascript injection hack (like the one too get the email) to change it to send the verification email to a different email?[/quote] [quote="jme_009, post:39, topic:32261"]Hmmm, Would it be possible to find out the generated confirmation link? Then you could actually get rid of the (email address not verified)[/quote]
Theres an idea, but no one seems to know how to do it. I have tried hex-editing MSN to change the name, but it remains. Can anyone do this?! I'm sure a lot of people would be pleased if someone could ;).
So the main question is: [b]Can someone find a way to get around the verification email, or send it to a different email altogether?[/b]

item.title: Eh...Any smart people?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’d imagine clicking the confirm link would send something like “ready - emailhere” to a secure server, it then generates a code and sends it.

Read full topic

item.title: Eh...Any smart people?
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

You won’t bypass it through client editing, seriously. the M$ server just regenerates the name… i tried it with some only messenger tools.
Easiest way would be brute forcing, but when i look at the verification code, it would take ages…

Read full topic

item.title: Eh...Any smart people?
item.dc:creator: @jimmy0s Jimmy OS
item.description:
@jimmy0s wrote:

leader:

If you don’t need it soon, I can figure it out. I would do it right now, but I need to finish my homework. Also I don’t want to go to bed late today. I hate school…it’s a pain.

It doesn’t really matter how long it takes, I’d wait a week :P, but I want the account verified :X.

Read full topic

item.title: Eh...Any smart people?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

leader:

I hate school…it’s a pain.

Oh well, it does. I got a long time though I still got all High school to go yet… WOOT ORIENTATION DAY AT HIGH SCHOOL.

Read full topic

item.title: Eh...Any smart people?
item.dc:creator: @leader leader
item.description:
@leader wrote:

You don’t really have to be smart for this, do you? The best thing to do is contact the guy who made the thread…he probably knows.

Read full topic

item.title: Eh...Any smart people?
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Lol, I was trying to do this a few minutes ago, but the only place I could find the email address was in text, which won’t help, and one place in a header. And I can’t find out where the form is submitted to. It might not be possible.

Read full topic
